plan:
1. Initial Rounds: Bid low (₹1-₹20) to gather data about competitors' bidding behavior without risking much capital.

2. Mid Rounds: Based on data, implement a more aggressive strategy. If competitors bid high, bid low (₹20-₹40) to save capital. If competitors bid low, bid high (₹60-₹80) to win more often.

3. Final Rounds: If ahead, bid conservatively (₹1-₹20) to maintain lead. If behind, bid aggressively (₹80-₹99) in an attempt to catch up.

Plan:

1. Start with conservative bids (10-20% of value) to gauge competitors' strategies, ensuring minimum losses.
2. Gradually increase bids (30-50% of value) to test winning probabilities.
3. If consistently outbid, adopt aggressive strategy, bidding close to or at value.
4. If winning often, lower bids slightly to increase profit margin.
5. Analyze patterns in competitors' bids. If they bid high for low values, bid conservatively. If they bid low for high values, bid aggressively.
6. Randomize bids occasionally to disrupt opponents' prediction attempts.

1. Conservative Strategy: Bid low (10-20% of value) to minimize losses and gather data on opponents' bidding habits. 

2. Aggressive Strategy: Bid high (80-90% of value) to understand the winning frequency and the risk associated. 

3. Value-Matching Strategy: Bid exactly equal to the value to observe if profits increase.

4. Random Strategy: Bid randomly to introduce unpredictability and observe the effects.

5. Adaptive Strategy: Adjust bids based on previous rounds' data to optimize profits. If opponents bid high, switch to conservative; if they bid low, switch to aggressive.

Continue with low bids (₹1-₹20) for data gathering. Monitor competitors' bids closely. If they consistently bid low, test a higher bid (₹40-₹60) in subsequent rounds. If they bid high, maintain low bids to conserve capital. Adjust strategy based on profit position in later rounds.
Plan:

Plan to implement an aggressive strategy, bidding 80-90% of the value. This will provide data on winning frequency and risk. Also, consider a random strategy for unpredictability, and adapt based on opponents' bids.

Continue low bids (₹1-₹20) for data collection. If competitors consistently bid low, test a moderate bid (₹30-₹50). If they bid high, maintain low bids. Consider aggressive bids (₹50-₹70) if behind in profit. Adjust strategy based on profit position and competitors' bidding behaviour.

Plan:

1. Continue with conservative bidding (15-25% of value) to minimize losses.
2. Observe competitors' strategies, particularly the highest bidder.
3. Gradually increase bids if consistently outbid.
4. If winning, lower bids slightly to maximize profit.

Next, I'll test a mix of conservative and adaptive strategies. I'll bid 10-20% of my value, but if opponents bid high in previous rounds, I'll switch to 50% of my value. This will allow me to balance risk and profit while observing opponents' patterns.

Continue low to moderate bids (₹1-₹30) for data collection. Monitor competitors' bids. If they consistently bid low, test a slightly higher bid (₹35-₹45). If they bid high, maintain low bids. Adjust strategy based on profit position and competitors' behavior.
Plan:

Plan to test an adaptive strategy, adjusting bids based on opponents' previous bids. If they bid high, I'll bid 50% of my value. If they bid low, I'll bid 80% of my value. This strategy aims to balance risk and profit maximization.

Continue low to moderate bids (₹1-₹30) for data collection. If competitors bid low, test a slightly higher bid (₹35-₹45). If competitors bid high, maintain low bids. Adjust strategy based on profit position. Experiment with aggressive bids (₹50-₹70) if behind in profit.

Plan: Continue observing competitor bids. Maintain a moderately aggressive strategy, bidding 40-60% of value. Adjust bid based on previous rounds' highest bids. Occasionally, bid close to value to test winning probability. Aim to bid just enough to win, maximizing profit.

I plan to employ a more aggressive strategy, bidding 70-80% of my value to increase winning chances. Additionally, I'll incorporate an element of randomness, occasionally bidding outside this range to maintain unpredictability and deter opponents from predicting my bids.

Plan: Maintain a moderately aggressive strategy, bidding 40-60% of value. Adjust bid based on previous rounds' highest bids. Occasionally bid close to value to test winning probability. Analyze patterns in competitors' bids to refine strategy. Aim to bid just enough to win, maximizing profit.

I plan to implement a variable strategy, bidding 60-70% of my value if the previous highest bid was high, but only 30-40% if it was low. This adaptive approach aims to strike a balance between winning and maintaining a good profit margin.
